SecurityProfile.Name: Base Policy
SecurityProfile.Description: A policy from which all other policies can inherit. Only the most general settings should be applied to this policy as they will apply to all policies that inherit from it, unless overridden. More specific settings and rules should be added to sub-policies that are assigned to computers.

SecurityProfile.Name: Deep Security
SecurityProfile.Description: A policy from which the various Deep Security policies inherit.

SecurityProfile.Name: Deep Security Virtual Appliance
SecurityProfile.Description: The recommended policy for use on a Deep Security Virtual Appliance.

SecurityProfile.Name: Deep Security Manager
SecurityProfile.Description:
A base policy for use on a server hosting the Deep Security Manager.
Important: After applying this Policy to your Deep Security Manager's Host, you must restart existing browser sessions to the Deep Security Manager. This is because the Policy applies a new SSL configuration to the Host. If you do not restart your session, your connection may be lost and multiple "Renewal Error" Intrusion Prevention Events will be generated by the Agent.

SecurityProfile.Name: Linux Server
SecurityProfile.Description: An example policy for Linux servers.

SecurityProfile.Name: Windows
SecurityProfile.Description: An example policy from which all the example Windows policies inherit. Any settings that are common to all Windows policies can be set here.

SecurityProfile.Name: Windows Server
SecurityProfile.Description: An example policy for Windows Server servers.

SecurityProfile.Name: Windows Desktop
SecurityProfile.Description: An example policy for Windows desktops.

SecurityProfile.Name: Solaris Server
SecurityProfile.Description: An example policy for Solaris servers.

IPList.Name: Domain Controller(s)
IPList.Description: A list of domain controllers from which clients should accept traffic

PortList.Name: Microsoft SQL Server
PortList.Description: Ports used by Microsoft SQL Server

PortList.Name: Remote Desktop
PortList.Description: Ports for accessing a machine using remote desktop/terminal services

PortList.Name: SSH
PortList.Description: Ports for accessing a machine using SSH

PortList.Name: Deep Security Manager
PortList.Description: Ports used by Deep Security Manager

PortList.Name: Exchange Server 2003 Firewall Ports
PortList.Description:
Incoming ports used by Exchange Server 2003
See the following technote for more information: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb124075(v=exchg.65).aspx
PortList.Items: 135 # RPC,102 # X.400,25 # SMTP,691 # Routing Engine,80 # HTTP for Outlook Web Access&com; and public folder admin,443 # HTTPS,110 # POP3,995 # POP3 over SSL,143 # IMAP4,993 # IMAP4 over SSL,119 # Network News Transfer Protocol (NNTP),563 # NNTP over SSL,379 # Site Replication Service,135 # RPC ,# 389 # optional for LDAP ,# Note that many services use dynamic ports by default. ,# Exchange Server should be configured to use static ports and these,# ports should be added to this list

PortList.Name: Domain Controller to Client (TCP)
PortList.Description: TCP ports used for Domain Controller to client traffic
PortList.Items: 42 # WINS,88 # Kerberos,135 # DCOM Service Control Manager,139 # netbios-ssn,445 # microsoft-ds,3268 # Global Catalog,3269 # Global Catalog over SSL

PortList.Name: Domain Controller to Client (UDP)
PortList.Description: UDP ports used for Domain Controller to client traffic
PortList.Items: 53 # DNS,88 # Kerberos,137 # Netbios-ns,138 # Netbios datagram service

PortList.Name: Deep Security Agent
PortList.Description: Ports used by Deep Security Agent

ScanFileList.Name: Process Image Files (Windows)
ScanFileList.Items: C:\Windows\system32\wbem\wmiprvse.exe<:>C:\Program Files\Citrix\User Profile Manager\UserProfileManager.exe<:>C:\Program Files\Citrix\Server Resource Management\Memory Optimization Management\Program\CtxSFOSvc.exe

PacketFilter.Name: Allow solicited TCP/UDP replies
PacketFilter.Description: UDP stateful and TCP stateful must be enabled

PacketFilter.Name: Allow solicited ICMP replies
PacketFilter.Description: ICMP stateful must be enabled

PacketFilter.Name: DHCP Client
PacketFilter.Description: Allow DHCP Offer traffic to a DHCP Client

PacketFilter.Name: ARP
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming ARP traffic

PacketFilter.Name: Deep Security Agent
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming traffic to Deep Security Agent

PacketFilter.Name: NetBios Name Service
PacketFilter.Description: For hosts that rely on NetBios for name resolution

PacketFilter.Name: DHCP Server
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming DHCP requests to a DHCP server

PacketFilter.Name: Wireless Authentication
PacketFilter.Description: Allow wireless authentication traffic

PacketFilter.Name: FTP Server
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming traffic to an FTP Server

PacketFilter.Name: Microsoft SQL Server
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming TCP traffic to a Microsoft SQL server

PacketFilter.Name: Oracle SQL Server
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming traffic to an Oracle SQL server

PacketFilter.Name: Deep Security Manager
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming traffic to Deep Security Manager

PacketFilter.Name: Microsoft Exchange Server
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming traffic to an Microsoft Exchange Server

PacketFilter.Name: Web Server
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming TCP traffic to a Web Server

PacketFilter.Name: Remote Access SSH
PacketFilter.Description: Allow remote access to machines

PacketFilter.Name: Domain Client (TCP)
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming traffic from the domain controller

PacketFilter.Name: Domain Client (UDP)
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming traffic from the domain controller

PacketFilter.Name: SMTP Server
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming TCP traffic to an SMTP Server

PacketFilter.Name: DNS Server
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming DNS requests to a DNS server

PacketFilter.Name: ICMP Echo Request
PacketFilter.Description: Allow incoming Ping requests

PacketFilter.Name: Remote Access RDP
PacketFilter.Description: Allow remote access to machines

StatefulFilter.Description: Enable stateful inspection for TCP, UDP and ICMP
